titleStmt.title: Charles Sulivan to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4931

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Frankfort May 12th 1864
Gov Bramlette,
Hon. Sir

as you ar awair I have bin ^a^ unfortunet man I am blind. and I ask your Simperthe and. Restore me to my friends I ashure you Sir that I will ever be graitfull to you and I shall ackt as a man Should. the ceapurs. I am Shure ar willing to have me releaced and If you will be cind enuf and come to the prison I know that the warden and ceapers will give you all the Information you wish I have bin hear ^Near^ five years. and have 5 to stay I was sent from Louisville for. Bourglery I have bin to your office But you wor not at the office So I hope you will do all that is consistent with your good nature and may God in his goodness bee with you and bless you Is a blind mans. Blessing & Prair as I cannot Recale my past Life I will try ^to^ do a better in the future.

I Remain your Humble Servant
Charles Sulivan
